website_summaries.verdict: A fast, durable machine that's designed to work best with online storage accounts.
pros: Easily send scanned pages to online storage
cons: Requires extra work to rename and relocate scanned PDFs

website_summaries.verdict: The Wi-Fi networkable Epson ES-500W scans and saves to searchable PDF faster than several of its entry-level competitors, but mediocre OCR accuracy diminishes its overall value.
pros: Fast scanning and saving to PDF
Comes with document and business card management software
Supports Wi-Fi, Wi-Fi Direct, and NFC
High daily duty cycle for the price

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic Scanner
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scanner to replace my Neat Desk Scanner that broke and Neat stop making scanners. I did some research and found the Epson ES-500W and it works FANTASTIC! I can scan documents, business cards, receipts, and much more. The software is easy to use, save various configurations to quickly select BW Single Sided, Color Single Sided, Color Double Sided, receipts, business cards, etc. If you have a small business or just want to get rid of the mountain of paper that comes with personal or business records management then get the Epson ES-500W and you will see how it performs as I did.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph - Aya's Travel

customer_reviews.title: Scans fast and quality PDFs when it wants to work!
customer_reviews.text: I thought the bad reviews were just user error, but no, this scanner constantly loses connection. It seems like I am always waiting for it to reconnect. The only thing that gets it working is to turn off the Wifi on the laptop/macbook and then reconnect it. It also saves the documents in random places - I am specifying where to save it in the preferences and I search and find the scanned documents elsewhere. I am not an IT tech but I am computer savvy enough to know that this is junk and not user error! I am going to contact Epson support and update my review. It angers me to see there is a 20% restocking fee!!
customer_reviews.author: Bay08

customer_reviews.title: Great Scanner
customer_reviews.text: I reviewed this scanner favorably shortly after buying it. Two months of use later, I find it even greater. I found today that the TWAIN driver has the sophistication to (reasonably) accurately rotate pages to the correct orientation for reading. Custom Paper sizes can be set and reused for non-standard documents. Its speed and auto-duplexing surpass the professional Fujitsu SCSI scanner it replaced, at 1/8 of what the Fujitsu scanner cost.This scanner continues to impress me.
customer_reviews.author: K. Burrows

customer_reviews.title: POS, don't buy, the software is bugged.
customer_reviews.text: TOTAL POS, at least the software is. Installed easily, connected easily, scans easily, until you get a 'Epson Job Runner has stopped working', then you get errors where it says it is busy or unable to connect. Uninstall, reinstall. same. Called Epson, they say bad driver or something, send me to the EXACT SAME PLACE I WENT TO to get the original drivers. I figured, what the heck? NOPE, same problem. I've uninstalled, reinstalled after rebooting at least 4 times. Installed as administrator. SAME. Screw this, buying the Fujitsu and sending this back. I don't need the headaches! Fujitsu is another $100 bucks, but at least it will work. Ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Not very encouraging.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this along with the Ethernet companion and it worked well for about two months and then black blocks would appear on the scanned pages. Called tech support and they worked on it for about an hour. Another unit was shipped out as a replacement which took 4 days. My credit card was charged $239.00 until they received the broken unit from us. The unit that we received as a replacement was bad also for thinner black blocks. So it was also returned. We now have another unit in hopes that it will last. I will update my post in the next few months.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Stops Working After Weeks
customer_reviews.text: I have had the same bad experience as previous 1 star reviewers. I have had this scanner for about 5 weeks now and at first it worked great then one day it wasn't working that good, now I cant even get it to connect to my computer. Amazon is sending me a replacement but I do not have much faith because I think it is an issue with the Epson WorkForce ES-400 itself, not my scanner in particular.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Nykole

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is a little work horse. It is fast and easy to use. Adjustments to contrast and brightness is a little clunky but once I figured it out, it worked well on some old faded pages. I have many years of paper files to scan and this scanner is making it much easier. I run it with Windows 10 with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: napawardlaw

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend. Easy to Use, but Powerful.
customer_reviews.text: Just got this baby set up last night, and I've already digitized an entire filing cabinet drawer of papers. The fact that it can do optical character recognition (OCR) to make searchable pdfs is amazing. Set-up was also pretty easy, but I made a walkthrough video (attached) to help you get through some of the tricky parts. Very happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Mes045

customer_reviews.title: Decent Scanner Poor WiFi Capability
customer_reviews.text: The scanner works great if you only want a wired connection. Unable to get it to connect thru my WiFi and EPSON support was no help in resolving the issue. I have multi printers, laptops and other devices connected thru my WiFi but the Epson scanner will not connect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Returning
customer_reviews.text: From the product description I thought that with their software, documents could be automatically sorted and sent to QuickBooks. And just like my printer can print from multiple computers, I thought this scanner could scan from multiple computers. I guess I was wrong on both accounts? I called Epson's tech support. I spent almost an hour on the phone before finally talking to someone in person. To make a long story short, I was told that I needed to spend an additional $400+ to get their networking device to operate multiple computers, and I never could get any answers that made sense about the software and QuickBooks. BIG waste of time. I will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Dluman

customer_reviews.title: Great Features, But!
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is fast & has great features if you can get it to work with your Wi-Fi; Was unable to connect to a Wi-Fi, even with considerable assistance from Epson Tech Support. Epson shipped another replacement unit & same problem occurred after spending 3 hours on the phone with Epson Tech Support, finally decided it is not worth it and sent is back. It seems like some customers have experienced the same issue with this unit; too bad it didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Bargain Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup, Double sided scanning, Easy to archive.
customer_reviews.text: Setup was easy, just followed the directions. Works great to eliminate paper. Double sided scanning works without any delay or interruption. Picks up the date of the scanned document so archiving is a breeze. Jams are few, but easily cleared. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: PJA66

customer_reviews.title: Nice scanner, excellent support.
customer_reviews.text: First one DOA. Called cust svc and they responded very well. Replacement arrived 2 days later. Returned old device in same shipping container new one arrived in, postage paid by Epson. New scanner worked perfectly. Features I needed easy to implement. Other available features I have not yet explored. This scanner is FAST, and very forgiving of imperfect originals. Much more convenient than the single- and double-sided scanners found in multi-function printers (which I haven't bothered to use since I got this little gem). If you found this review helpful please indicate below. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Winafew

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Scanner for Home and Small Office Use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scanner (now 4 of them) for my office to replace another more expensive brand that we had been using for years. There was absolutely nothing wrong with the other brand, other than the high price tag on the device. I ventured for something a little less expensive and started with 1 scanner to see if it was comparable. What we found is that everyone in the office is begging to have their scanners replaced with this one. It's fast and gets the job done. Solid device and recommend for small offices (we actually do HEAVY scanning so maybe medium offices would work as well).
customer_reviews.author: Ana Zaun

customer_reviews.title: Jams and tears papers
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. I returned it right away. It is fast and scans with ease etc, except it is more of a shredder and it promptly tore up half my documents for work, which were important notarized docs. Do not leave unattended to scan! I got the refurbished and that’s the last time I do that. I returned it the same day for a full refund and ordered a competing brand and model that cost more, but am keeping my fingers crossed.
customer_reviews.author: e.e.drew

customer_reviews.title: Basic Functionality
customer_reviews.text: This scanner was nearly impossible to install because Windows 10 refused to recognize the driver. I had to use a manual method, finally, after about an hour of other attempts. The scanner itself is much slower than the Fujitsu Scan Snap but it works about the same. The hardware interface is not very intuitive and I have not figured out how to just place a document in the scanner and press a button. I have had to resort to using the app on the computer. The price was such that I will not return it but if I ever have to buy another one I would have to think twice before purchasing another of the same model.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Holland

customer_reviews.title: Wifi install is not so simple.
customer_reviews.text: I know what I'm doing and following the instructions does not work for WEP wifi. Here's what to. Install the drivers onto the computers that will use the scanner. Close the app down when it get to selection of USB or Wifi. Make sure the scanner is on, make sure the computer is on the same wifi network. Open the app epson smart scan, it will look for the scanner by IP. once you see it on the list select it and your set to go. Simple. I hope this saves someone the hour I lost following the lousy set up instructions. Other than that the scanner works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: This device is a brick on my desk because the Epson support website is down and I cannot download the driver. Customer service was useless. Support advised that the site will be down indefinitely, and the only solution they could come up with was to send me an email link to their downed website, brilliant! This is my last experience with Epson.
customer_reviews.author: WKS

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed as highend scanner
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for small compact foldable scanner with high quality scan with auto feeder, after researching online though this would be best option I might have but I was completely disappointed. I use MacBook Pro where I have struggle to install driver for this. downloaded latest version of driver but still same issue. look some instruction on epson support site but could not find helpful one. not sure how it will work on windows pc but for Mac its completly disappointed me. scanner does not detect when connect to MacBook Pro (2019).
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Cheap isn't always good
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to replace my scanner that would no longer work with my Mac. I purchased this one and it was nothing but heartache. I ended up returning it and getting a different model. It wouldn't do one button scanning as it was supposed to and a lot of the features were not well developed. The scanning speed was much slower than was expected. It was totally unacceptable and no one could help me. I sent it back. The replacement I purchased was much more expensive, but bulletproof and set up almost instantly, something this one didn't do.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: This unit has been a problem since the day I bought it. It has never once scanned without me having to uninstall/reinstall. I've tried it in every USB port my Windows 10 computer has. My husband is a Network VP and he has spent hours with it and not been able to get it to work. I have spent countless hours on the phone with Epson User Support trying to get this scanner to just work. It is so frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna White

customer_reviews.title: won't stay connected to computer
customer_reviews.text: Update: the third unit that arrived was connected by an IT company. It works ok, but not if I initiate the scan from the scanner. I’m still not increasing the number of stars it gets. Absolutely one of the worst Amazon transactions ever. Amazon totally screwed up the order - several times. Now that I have the correct scanner - Epson is the worst as far as software goes! I can't keep the dang thing connected to the computer! Even with the USB cable connection, it won't talk to my laptop. I've had to call Epson 4 times. I really hate this thing. It's great when it does work, but that's not very often :-(
customer_reviews.author: Rachel J.

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but simple to use and good quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought a few of these for the accounting team at the office and they are wonderful. They've helped us go to a more paperless office and the scan quality is good. The document feeder works well and the double sided scanning is great. You don't even need to change a setting it just does it automatically. They are a little pricey but worth the cost for the efficiency we've gained.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: This is a FLAWED model
customer_reviews.text: We bought this scanner to replace an Ambir duplex high-speed scanner that was going on the fritz. Installation went went, though there seems to be a communication error between the Epson scanner and our desktop. We got it replaced thinking wenjust got a defective one. The replacement arrived within 4 days. Same issue. Sending it back for a full refund and ended up splurging by buying a Fujitsu ix1500. We’ll see how that one goes.
customer_reviews.author: Lyn

customer_reviews.title: very fast
customer_reviews.text: This unit is really fast. I load multiple sheets of double sided copy and it just zooms them through. Scans are crisp, easy to read and it adjusts easily for the various sized inputs, including cash register receipts. The dialog box is easy to understand and allows the needed flexibility in determining what you are scanning, how the output should be formated, etc. Quickly recognized by the various Windows 10 machines on my network, no need to load drivers, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Don Steward

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought this scanner
customer_reviews.text: This scanner really works great. Very fast document feeder can easily hold 50 pages, scans fast and never jams. And using this scanner requires no technical skill or knowledge. Just plug it in to a computer and it sets itself up. Highly recommended!!!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Miller

customer_reviews.title: Works wirelessly with Mac or PC
customer_reviews.text: Needed an inexpensive scanner that worked with both Mac and PC. Haven't had it long yet, but setup was OK, and it scans to compact PDF files through a wireless home network. You can use it with multiple varying computers in the house, but NOT AT THE SAME TIME. If you connect to it with one computer; you have to disconnect before accessing from another different computer. But that's OK for me. Should be interesting to see how it holds up over time. It's all plastic with many unfolding parts. Doesn't look like it would hold up to lots of abuse.
customer_reviews.author: Choochoo

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Scanner
customer_reviews.text: Refurbished unit that works flawless, easy setup aka driver installation and software. Auto Paper-feed is smooth and solid image at 300 dpi. Still learning the ins and outs of it, yet content for upcoming scanning projects. For the discounted cost, it does the job remarkably. Software is a no brainer, elementary level use.
customer_reviews.author: LJABQ

customer_reviews.title: I love the footprint, the speed and the price.
customer_reviews.text: Small footprint, fast scanning, easy to set up, good software package. No more taking big documents to the office to scan. The page feeder has a 35 page limit but that’s fine. Honestly, I love this thing. I have never been this well-organized.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Dedrick

customer_reviews.title: A good, compact document scanner....
customer_reviews.text: I needed a good document scanner to organize all of the papers in my home. A lot of time went into the research before I chose this one. It is very small and easy to use. There are already almost 700 fewer pieces of paper around here now and many more to go. It's hard to destroy the hard copies sometimes, but one home disaster like a fire, water leak, or bad storm could quickly and permanently ruin them. My scans are all saved in multiple places like cloud storage, computer, and external hard drives. A few originals, like wills and other legal papers, have been scanned and also kept.
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: Top notch scanner!
customer_reviews.text: Quality: IMHO, you can't beat the quality of Epson scanners. I used to borrow one, now I have my own:). Speed: don't recall the exact spec, but I scanned 124 pages, double sided, color, in about 3 minutes. Paper: handles anything I put through it including card stock. Tip: like a lot of owners, I got an error message when downloading the software from Epson.com that the scanner couldn't connect to my PC. Checked multiple online blogs about this and couldn't solve the problem. Called a friend of mine and he said the since it the scanner is a late model to connect it to a USB-3 port instead of a USB-3 port. Problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: Vern Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scanner after my Fujitsu finally tanked. I couldn't get a part for it so I reluctantly ordered the Epson, which was nearly half of what a Fujitsu costs. I am pleasantly surprise at it's speed, clarity and ease of installation. The Fujitsu was great for when I scanned 6 file drawers of documents to go paperless, but the Epson ES-400 is perfect for basic everyday use. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: LOU ANN LaBOHN

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Document Scanner for the Money
customer_reviews.text: Finally got fed up with my network scanner being so flakey. Many thanks to all who reviewed this product prior to my purchase. Your advice solidified my selection, saved me much frustration and had me up and running quickly. I've been beating on it for a few months scanning thousands of pages of old training materials I didn't want to let go but also didn't want to store. It scans and OCRs everything so fast I kick myself for not buying it sooner. The only issue that I have had with it, is scanning longer receipts. In these instances, I just cut the receipt in half and run them thru. Great job Epson!
customer_reviews.author: Charles J. Sarchet

customer_reviews.title: Could be a five star
customer_reviews.text: The ES400 is quiet and very fast. Small footprint on the desktop. It is easy to scan with a one touch button push. The one thing that I have not yet figured out is how to get it to scan a page absolutely straight. The images are slightly skewed from the vertical. I push the guide slides right to the edges and make sure everything is centered, but the scanned pages are slightly skewed. I have selected the de-skew functions but still no noticeable difference. If you can put up with a lightly deskewed scan then this is a great scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: We use it to scan records at the front desk at a Healthcare clinic. Works great, fast enough
customer_reviews.author: CBB

customer_reviews.title: I honestly don’t know if I received a bad one
customer_reviews.text: I honestly don’t know if I received a bad one but this thing keeps giving trouble. Everyday I have to mess with it by either unplugging, restarting it or opening it up to make it work. I’ve had it for about 6 months and it still is a headache to deal with sometimes. Unfortunately I missed the return policy when I first bought it (14 days) the main problem with this scanner is when I try to scan multiple pages at once it gives an error message and I either have to restart or scan about 3-5 times until it takes it. Other than that this scanner is amazing in clarity and speed! Too bad I can’t exchange it.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandra

customer_reviews.title: Faster than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Just started using this for digitizing paper files in my office. Jam free extremely fast color duplex scanning, just as advertised. Our chart files are thick and this unit handles it fine with accurate, detailed reproduction. Plug and play, easy to use interface for flipping pages. *I have not used tech support so cannot accurately rate.*
customer_reviews.author: -JP

customer_reviews.title: Best Scanner OCR on the Market!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this unit for scanning documents in at work, and the OCR built in makes everything so much easier if you want the scanned file to be able to keyword search terms. Although if anything is handwritten and not nicely, it won't recognize the actual word. I don't use the Epson filing system, I used and love FileCenter.
customer_reviews.author: TheChiliKid

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Scanner!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a small home based business where I do photo scanning and custom photo books for clients and occasionally I get asked to scan documents. I had a very old high end document scanner but the software was terrible and it was very temperamental so I bought this unit and I'm so glad that I did!! It's easy to install and use, it's fast and the software is great. I highly the document scanner. Perfect for personal or small business use. I ordered with it overnight shipping and it took all of 5 minutes to install and I was up and running in no time.
customer_reviews.author: MarketingMom

customer_reviews.title: Awesome after setup
customer_reviews.text: This is fabulous, but very difficult to get setup on PC laptops. I was successful after 2-3 full attempts. My girlfriend tried to install on her laptop on our same network and we cannot get it done yet—4 full attempts. EPSON is as good as Fujitsu but you need to be patient and do setup EXACTLY as directed!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Acierno

customer_reviews.title: Not that great, but not bad either
customer_reviews.text: I have this Epson ES-400 and an old Fujitsu ScanSnap feed style scanner. This Epson has the feature of being able to scan way more papers in a single document. But the documents it creates are crap. It doesn't self correct and it picks up noise and specks, adds in extra blank pages, and the image quality is sub par. My ScanSnap is super old and doesn't support a ton of pages, so I though this Epson would be a big upgrade. But the actual scans it produces is so sub par in comparison. It's incredibly disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Some random person

customer_reviews.title: does what it says
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Ordered this because my Canon TR8250 has been letting me down in the scanning department as a mobile notary. Today I drove away from my house to scan in a randomly picked location and it worked like a charm. Very satisfied with the purchase. I'll let you know if anything changes Edit: did my first signing with this today (next day) and it worked great. My signers were impressed with how professional it made me look
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Scanner - beats Fujitsu
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this Epson Scanner now for 3 months and I love it. I previously owned a Fujitsu Scanner and purchased an Epson this time around because of the $100 price difference. I can't speak to longevity. Some of the Epson reviews claim that the Epson doesn't last as long as the Fujitsu. But in terms of ease of use and user interface, the Epson beats the Fujitsu hands down. If I had to do it all over again, I would choose the Epson Scanner any day.
customer_reviews.author: O. Bick

customer_reviews.title: Fast, reliable, with great software
customer_reviews.text: This thing is terrific! We bought it to replace our xerox scanner and it has proven to be far superior. It’s very fast, automatically detects double sided scans, and the software is really easy to use. Each time you make a scan, the software pops up to guide you through the process. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Observer

customer_reviews.title: Did not work via WiFi in our office
customer_reviews.text: Although things worked fine when we connected to the scanner via the USB cable, we could not get the scanner to work across our WiFi network. Even with some very knowledgable network engineers involved and with Epson tech support on the phone for hours, we were unable to get the scanner to work via WiFi. The only way we were able to get it to semi-work was to have our computer connect via WiFi to the access point broadcast by the scanner. Of course, this means that the computer cannot access the WiFi network of the office while scanning. This is NOT what I expect to get when I pay extra for "WiFi" support in a scanner. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: John Nalbone

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Quick setup and small desktop footprint. Took a couple of tries to feed the paper upside down and top first. Automatically deletes blank pages and scans the back of double sided pages. When you scan a prompt pops up on your screen; so you can save it or process the scan. This is the third Epson product sitting on my desk. All are working well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So Happy
customer_reviews.text: I had a Fujitsu Scansnap that was orphaned by the latest Mac OSX update. This scanner is twice as fast and doesn’t misdeed. The software is great. So happy
customer_reviews.author: Frank Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Fast, and feature filled
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fast. Stick a document in it to be scanned and in less than a couple seconds you have a searchable clearly readable PDF.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Wow fast!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fast, does 2 sides at the same time, and the image quality is really good
customer_reviews.author: Dmh529

customer_reviews.title: Love this.
customer_reviews.text: This is just a fantastic scanner for the price. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is that the quality isn't excellent. However, I love everything else about it. It's easy to set up, easy to use, it opens up the file for you automatically, you can scan in multi document pages in single or double sided, you can delete pages, add more pages to the scan if you forget some before you ultimately save it.... It's great. I'm super happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my office for a paperless environment
customer_reviews.text: I scan everyday as I don’t want any paper. I am a therapist where I have an electronic health record. So scanning in any papers into my clients chart is easy along with scanning in documents and checks I have mobile depositors to be shared with my billing staff.
customer_reviews.author: Greg and Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Fast and reliable scanner!
customer_reviews.text: I can’t figure out the poor reviews for this scanner. The software works fine. Perhaps the most important step in the software installation process is to have the scanner disconnected first, and then install the software and then reconnect it to the computer. Worked fine within minutes. My first day of ownership I scanned a couple thousand pages and it only took a few hours. The bottle neck being the time it took to load the feeder. I’d recommend and buy this scanner again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Swordsman73

customer_reviews.title: a crappy machine
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what is going on, but this brand new scanner will not work. I am so pissed!! How much did I pay for this??? Want more ... there is no help BECAUSE they are open to support from Monday thru Friday. WTF!!! Do NOT buy this machine. You will not get the drivers to load properly.
customer_reviews.author: Christy C Crigler

customer_reviews.title: This thing is wonderful.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love it. I scanned 2 years worth of bills in 45 minutes or so. That includes me sorted it all out. The paper flies though this machine fast. It is plenty fast, you won't need a faster scanner. Some people don't like the software. The software is super simple, but it's fine. Just scan your papers and give the file a name like "June 2018 bills". Not sure what else the software needs to do for you. Great purchase. Get one!
customer_reviews.author: Mikey Mike

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and use instantly
customer_reviews.text: Very easy user interface. Excellent support. Superb quality scan. This is exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: KJ824

customer_reviews.title: Installation is impossible
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed in this scanner. The installation process does not work and the scanner wouldn't connect to my (brand new) computer despite trying different USB cords, plugging/unplugging, restarting, uninstalling/reinstalling, restarting, installing drivers separately, etc. After 2 hours of fighting with it and trying all the "troubleshooting" instructions (which were useless) I gave up and returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quick easy scanner
customer_reviews.text: My expensive Fujiitu scanner was great, but constantly lost communication with my computer, for no reason at all. This Epson was a breeze to install, but if you want Wifi, you'll need to spiritually connect to Albert Einstein. I know there's a trick to it, but forget it and buy the 400 for a few bucks less. Great software included and I hope it works as well as it has so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Total Junk, bought 2 Brand New Ones and both defective
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my Fujitsu Scanner that wore out and when the first one arrived, we plugged it in and it wouldn't even power up. So Amazon replaced it for us with a second new one, it actually powered up but the computer didn't recognize the scanner, we called Epson and they determined that the second scanner is also defective, I'm going back to Fujitsu, a waste of time and money for us!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Scanner!
customer_reviews.text: I've have the Fujitsu ScanSnap S1500 and was looking for an alternative that was cheaper and as good for my home office due to Covid-19. I ordered this one and it's great. It is as good as the Fujitsu. I already recommended it to another colleague.
customer_reviews.author: Sev Grigorian

customer_reviews.title: Nice scanner, just wish it didn't keep having trouble reading the USB connection
customer_reviews.text: It scans fast and well. My only objection is that even though I continue scanning on and off, it keeps having trouble just identifying that I am using the USB cable and sometimes I have to restart laptop to get it to identify USB correctly. Maybe this is my laptop, but I cannot tell. I wish technology hadn't progressed to the point that it does more to hamper than help.
customer_reviews.author: findingmyway

customer_reviews.title: No more need for filling cabinets!
customer_reviews.text: Push a button and it will blast through your documents scanning them front and back. The hopper holds 50 pages, but you can add pages while it is scanning. I have scanned 300+ page documents in just over 5 minutes. 200 dpi is the fastest scan mode, but it gives your very clear and readable documents. I set up a "scanner inbox", then go back through rename the files, and move them into folders. With this method I load the scanner, push the green scan button, and let it work while I work on something else. Get rid of all those filling cabinets, and save some space with this scanner!
customer_reviews.author: R. Paxton

customer_reviews.title: Compact, Fast, Efficient
customer_reviews.text: Thisscanner is easy to use and works well with my desktop computer. Its compact design makes it easy to fit on my desk and doesn't take up a lot of room. It scans about 30 pages at a time and adds the next stack to the same document set. My document sets are typically 100+ pages and they take no time to scan in to my computer. Jams are easy to fix with the one-button front panel opening. You can choose one-sided or 2-sided scans in one pass. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline West

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner, one issue.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve probably scanned over 10,000 pages at this point. The scanner is fast and clear. The only issue I have is when a small piece of paper or dust or anything gets on the sensor you get 100 pages with a white or black streak on every page. Thus your opening the scanner and cleaning the sensor / reader fairly frequently.
customer_reviews.author: JXP

customer_reviews.title: Great Scanner!
customer_reviews.text: I have always used Printer based scanners and dreamed of a scanner similar to the ones on the Copiers at work. This Scanner is as close as you can get for a reasonable price. It is fast and the interface is solid. You can scan directly into Adobe or your preferred software using TWAIN or just use the software included to scan directly to file. Turn on Text enhancement in the settings to get ultra crisp text if you're scanning docs and you will be all set. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tyson S

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: Scanner worked great for 3 weeks, then suddenly kept receiving on screen message that scanner was unavailable or busy....try again later. Uninstalled/reintstalled software several times. Spent over 1.5 hours with Epson technicians trying to resolve issue...no luck.
customer_reviews.author: PB

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific scanner. It's fast and so easy to set up. It was more money that I had planned on spending, but it is so worth it. It scanned both sides and cropped it perfectly so far.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Grubb

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great.. but Died after Three months
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work now!!! I can't see how to return it, or get tech support.
customer_reviews.author: Portland Neurofeedback, LLC

customer_reviews.title: Real Work Horse
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to scan copies of on aircraft manuals from the Smithsonian Museum Simple to use and set-up I used it connected to my iMac Included software was sufficient Tries using it on old photos (Says no to be used for photos) Scanned over 4,000 photos Only down side was the limited DPI
customer_reviews.author: R. Cervenka

customer_reviews.title: Great Scanner if you already have a printer without one.
customer_reviews.text: The software interface is great. Let's you create different set-ups for Auto Scan. Single or double sided. Resolution Type of document to create What folder on you PC to save it too. Love it. Great for making digital copies of financial, insurance, billings, etc. I put the originals in a single paper file I call Scanned. The real filing is in my PC and backed up. When needed, it is a lot easier than shuffling through papers about Medicare, supplemental insurance, medical bills, retirement financial documents like banking, investments and IRA documents. With my "where did I put it" memory, it is a God send. Gives me peace of mind while I'm looking for my phone, glasses and car keys.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Treiber

customer_reviews.title: and the hardware seems to be sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after failing to get the ScanSnap software to install for the Fujitsu scanner. Thought the Fujitsu programmers must be incompetent. Epson software can install, but Epson should hire more competent programmers. The Document Capture Pro crashes all the time. It scans the pages, but at the end, it spews out a runtime error, then everything stops working, showing an error of unable to communicate with scanner. Was ready to return it, but then found the Scan 2 utility works. Scanned dozens of pages for testing, so far the quality seems to be OK, and the hardware seems to be sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. History

customer_reviews.title: Paper jam fest
customer_reviews.text: Received today as the replacement of my old Canon DR-!125. Unlike Canon, not only this scanner can't handle thick paper such as magazine cover, it jams paper like crazy. Even with its slow mode, still managed to tear my old concert flyer. I am returning it today.
customer_reviews.author: madflute

customer_reviews.title: When it works, it works well, but at ...
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it works well, but at least several times a day, it says the scanner is unavailable and cannot be found. Online support says unplug the cable and plug it back in, which works for a while, and then it goes back to the same problem. Contacted Epson tech support and they told me to change to a USB 2.0 cable. I bought this because it was advertised as being USB 3.0. Returning product.
customer_reviews.author: Confounded

customer_reviews.title: This thing is amazing
customer_reviews.text: This is one the coolest scanners I've ever used. Easy to use, can can receipts, cards, and multiple pages at a time quick and efficient. A little pricey, but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Very good scanner.
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to use with my iMac. User interface is simple and easy to use. The scans transfer really fast to the computer. The software allows you to rotate the images before you save it to a file. It scans licenses and other cards with ease. It definitely helped me clean out my file cabinet and digitize/organize my documents. I’m very happy with this product. You will eventually be looking for stuff around the house to digitize lol.
customer_reviews.author: Josiah Schunk

customer_reviews.title: Good quick little scanner
customer_reviews.text: It was a little tricky to set up on my computer. I'm not sure if it had anything to do with my security software or not. Can't recall. Scanning the documents are easy. Going through the documents is a little time consuming; but, good to have the information as a reference for my small business. Importing receipts into QuickBooks and coding to the proper accounts takes more time than entering them directly.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Caltabiano

customer_reviews.title: Fast, reliable performance
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this machine in my office for about 2 months. We do a ton of scanning. It’s a little temperamental if you have different width docs in one stack, but other than that, it’s awesome. The machine is fast and set up is super easy. The software is easy to use. Almost want to buy a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with Epson for the first time... :-(
customer_reviews.text: It worked great when it first arrived, but quickly stopped scanning. I would not recommend for anyone other than personal use... maybe our small office wore it out. I have never been disappointed with Epson products or service, but with this, I am. We tried calling support and they have been no help and not offered a replacement or anything. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: TBLMT

customer_reviews.title: out standing product the best ever
customer_reviews.text: i have never see a product work so well in my life no hick ups no issue no problem it work just as promised. it was fast and easy the instruction were clear and the whole process was nice. i would recommend this to everyone out there that are looking for some kind of scanner. i manage to scan over 400 pages in under 15 minutes perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Baruch Lorio

customer_reviews.title: Your scanning “Best Friend”
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had one of these before (same model), and accidentally pulled the USB cord too hard and broke the connection :( Took me awhile to buy another- and I bought this specific model for a reason, I LOVE this machine! If you are a document scanning dude who wants to convert your filing cabinet into a digital one- THIS IS IT! Not recommended for photos (it’s too fast to be that accurate- get a flatbed scanner for that). If you want to scan multiple pages at a time (I’ve scanned a 100 page document flawlessly). This is a workhorse! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Evan Adair

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic scanner
customer_reviews.text: I bought an expensive 3 in 1 printer by Epson and the scan feature stunk so got this and it’s wonderful! Easy to use and has a lot of great features. I’d recommend it
customer_reviews.author: K. Sky

customer_reviews.title: It Is A Workhorse
customer_reviews.text: I have scanned all of my genealogical documents, which filled a footlocker, in no time at all. Fast, easy to use, and doesn't jam unless the user does something stupid, like leave a paper clip or staple in on a document. Now I'm a "Scanning Fool".
customer_reviews.author: R. Blais

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup and the papers literally fly through this thing. We're on our way to creating a paperless file system. I always did like Epson products and I have to say I'm pleased with the smaller size. I also like that we don't have to lift the lid on the big scanner every time we want to scan a paper - just feed it through!
customer_reviews.author: S. Beck

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent Connection
customer_reviews.text: Unreliable. Like others have said, the connection to the computer is inconsistent. Sometimes I cannot get the computer to recognize it at all without rebooting. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: JCS

customer_reviews.title: Great Scanner
customer_reviews.text: I converted my office to online file storage in 1997 using Visoneer scanners and Paperport. In all my years of experience, I have never seen a better scanner. This scanner is amazing. The software is great. Based on some of the reviews I read, I was prepared to be disappointed. I can”t imagine why anyone would not be totally satisfied with this scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Alton

customer_reviews.title: WORKS WELL, NICE SCANS
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is great once you have mastered the software. You tell it where to put scanned files and sometimes it puts them where it wants. There were a few software updates and now it seems to be working better. So much better than scanning i file at a time. This makes some great images.
customer_reviews.author: AZCAMERA REVIEWSTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great Document Scanner
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my nephew. He was overjoyed to receive it. He quickly installed it and starting using it and was very impressed with its performance. Scanning was done quickly and results were clear. Did an awesome job.
customer_reviews.author: Hermelinda Flores

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner
customer_reviews.text: I love this scanner and it's so easy to use. Would highly recommend it. I use it to scan postcards to sell online. It's a quick and simple job with this scanner and I don't run into the major discoloring problems like I have with other scanners.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty pricey, but you’re getting what you pay for. It’s definitely a really good scanner. It does double sided pages, and will auto remove blanks. When it jams... usually because I missed removing a staple or something, it’s easy to remove and restart from where I left off. It’s by far the best scanner I’ve used.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Young

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to get rid of filed paper
customer_reviews.text: This scanner has worked like a dream. In just a few hours I got rid of thick files that had 5 years or more of utility and other receipts. Now I am using it to scan music scores into a digital library. Excellent scanner for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: William E.

customer_reviews.title: Great little scanner
customer_reviews.text: This scanner works very quickly and has improved our work flow. I was aware it didn't have a "bed", so I hesitated but we haven't missed the bed at all. It is very reliable and we love how quick it scans, and does duplex in one pass. I purchased two and they get a pretty good workout daily. We use to scan invoices, various sizes, paper types and colors and it has served the purpose well. No complaints so far and far better than the scanners we replaced. One of the girls was so happy it took up so little desk space.
customer_reviews.author: V. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Fast
customer_reviews.text: Very fast feed and then displays both sides and gives the options for what ever you want to do with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Huge waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this scanner in May to replace one I knew would not work with the Catalina MAC OS upgrade. However, I never unpackaged it until today, after installing the upgrade. Guess what? It doesn't work. NOT. AT. ALL. Foolish of me to not check it out before now. The return window is closed, and I'm out almost $300.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Cook

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner
customer_reviews.text: Moved up to this dedicated scanner after fighting with an ALL-IN-ONE. This scanner is a dream to operate. Love the software, maybe that is because of my old ALL-IN-ONE was SLOW and a pain to use. Does what I want and need. So I could not be happier.
customer_reviews.author: P. Guillotte

customer_reviews.title: Efficiency
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is perfect for an office setting as it does not take up much space, yet scans a range of different document sizes. It also does double-sided scanning. It is easy to select whether to save the document, email it, etc. The price is quite reasonable for the quality of this scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Connie T

customer_reviews.title: Best Document Scanner I've Ever Had
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this scanner's ability to quickly scan a whole sheaf of documents. So far, it has scanned everything I threw at it without jamming even once, and I have used very thin sheets of paper. My only gripe is it's too narrow -- would have loved for it to be at least 11 inches instead of 8.5.
customer_reviews.author: Zergrinch

customer_reviews.title: Fast
customer_reviews.text: This crazy thing is fast. Loving it so far. Scans both sides at once if you want both sides scanned. I was reluctant to buy it because of other review, but it's good.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Stemmons

customer_reviews.title: The unit I received did not turn on. Seems like it would be a convenient printer combo to have
customer_reviews.text: It seems like this would be a really nice printer scanner combo. It's small, lightweight, and unpacks easily. Unfortunately, when I tried turning it on, nothing happened. Not sure what went wrong, I wish I could say more about it, but it wouldn't turn on.
customer_reviews.author: Yoda's wisdom

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!
customer_reviews.text: I spent an excessive amount of time downloading, re-installing, and attempting to find solutions just to get this stupid thing to scan one page - never did happen. What a complete waste of my time, and will probably be a waste of yours too.
customer_reviews.author: Joanie

customer_reviews.title: Great for small office
customer_reviews.text: this printer was purchased for a small office and works great for a staff of 3-4. High quality saturated prints. Even personal photographs look nice. A little bulky but what do you expect from a printer. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Stoll

customer_reviews.title: No Longer Works
customer_reviews.text: We have had this scanner for less than four months now and it already does not work. I cannot figure out how to contact Amazon about warranty information or returning it. For a $300 product, I expect it to work a lot longer than 4 months
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

product_meta.title: Epson WorkForce ES-500W Wireless Color Duplex Document Scanner for PC and Mac, Auto Document Feeder (ADF)
product_meta.description:
Style:Epson Workforce ES-500The WorkForce ES-500WR duplex document scanner makes it easy to organize your life ― and your finances. It comes with premium accounting features (1), and enables you to wirelessly scan documents, receipts and invoices to a PC, Mac, smartphone, tablet or cloud storage account (2). The powerful ES-500WR makes it simple. Featuring speeds up to 35 ppm/70 ipm (3) and a 50-page Auto Document Feeder, this compact, reliable performer breezes through stacks of documents — from business and ID cards to extra-long invoices, and more. Easily scan to searchable PDFs and editable Word and Excel files with included Epson ScanSmart Accounting Edition Software (2). 

1. Requires Epson ScanSmart Accounting Edition Software. Not available for iOS or Android mobile devices. 
2. Wirelessly scan to smartphones or tablets (Android/iOS devices) via the Epson DocumentScan App; wirelessly scan to the cloud, PCs or Macs with Epson ScanSmart Accounting Edition Software installed on the connected Windows PC or Mac. Epson ScanSmart Accounting Edition Software supports Windows 10 (32-bit, 64-bit), Windows 8/8.1 (32-bit, 64-bit), Windows 7 (32-bit, 64-bit) SP1 and Mac OS X 10.11.x to macOS 10.13.x. 
3. Based on letter-sized scans at 300 dpi in Black-and-White, Grayscale or Color Mode, using the USB interface. Results may vary based on processor speed, memory and operating system of the connected computer. 
4. For convenient and reasonable recycling options, visit our official site. 
5. SmartWay is an innovative partnership of the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency that reduces greenhouse gases and other air pollutants and improves fuel efficiency.
feature_bullets: Wirelessly scan to your smartphone, tablet or computer : plus online cloud storage accounts(1); PC and Mac compatible
Easily scan stacks of paper : robust 50 page Auto Document Feeder. Document Sizes- Max-8.5 x 240 inches. Min-2 x 2 inches
Compatible with most software : the included TWAIN driver allows for easy connection to most document management software
Versatile scanning for everyday documents : business and ID cards, single sheets, extra long pages and more
Built-in Nuance Optical Character Recognition (OCR) : create searchable PDFs and editable Word and Excel files

Easy sharing and collaboration : email or upload to popular cloud storage services(1) such as Dropbox, Evernote, Google Drive. Power Consumption - Operation 17 W. Wireless 18 W. Sleep - 1.4 W. Ready 9.2 W. Off - 0.1 W
Intelligent color and image adjustments : auto crop, blank page and background removal with Epson Image Processing Technology
Reliable paper feeding system : Ultrasonic Double Feed Detection prevents missing pages; also features Dynamic Skew Correction
Get organized in a snap : scan up to 35 ppm/70 ipm(2); Single Step Technology captures both sides in one pass
Powerful software included : easy scanning with intuitive Epson ScanSmart Software(1); preview, email, upload and more; automatic file naming and object recognition save time

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,320 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
